page_content:
Amazon Web Services

AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM)

AWS Identity and Access Management (IAM) enables you to manage users and user permissions in AWS. The service is targeted at organizations with multiple users or systems that use AWS products. You can centrally manage users, security credentials such as access keys, and permissions. aws.amazon.com/iam/

Features

  • Multi-factor authentication (MFA)
  • Manage IAM users and their access
  • Manage IAM roles and their permissions
  • Manage user credentials
  • Manage federation
  • Grant any user temporary security credentials with a defined expiration
  • Granular control
  • Secure by default

Benefits

  • Control access to AWS services and resources
  • Control which operations can be performed
  • Grant your employees and applications federated access to AWS
  • Protect your AWS environment by using multi-factor authentication (MFA)
  • Leverage external identity systems
  • Flexible security credential management
  • Granular control

Pricing

£0.0 to £0.0 per instance per hour

  • Excluding VAT
  • Minimum contract period: Hour

Service documents

  • pdf document: Service definition
